intro: Waltheria acapulcensis, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, showy flowers that bloom in shades of purple and blue. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded areas and has heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
